metadata.title: CVE-2021-28861 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description: ** DISPUTED ** Python 3.x through 3.10 has an open redirectionvulnerability in lib/http/server.py due to no protection against multiple(/) at the beginning of URI path which may leads to information disclosure.NOTE: this is disputed by a third party because the http.server.htmldocumentation page states "Warning: http.server is not recommended forproduction. It only implements basic security checks."

criterions.comment: python2.7: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
python3.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
